titles.title: Expressing the sense of the Congress that Harriet Tubman should have been paid a pension for her service as a nurse and scout in the United States Army during the Civil War.
Expressing the sense of the Congress that Harriet Tubman should have been paid a pension for her service as a nurse and scout in the United States Army during the Civil War.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Total Force.

term.name: Civil Rights and Liberties, Minority Issues

bill.summary: Expresses the sense of Congress that Harriet Tubman should have been paid a pension at the rate of $25 each month for her service as a nurse and scout in the U.S. Army during the Civil War.
